moves.1. e4: My first win after a very long losing streak so I thought I would annotate this for posterity. For me, not my best game ever and it could have gone either way. In the end I just got lucky
moves.1... d5: I haven't played the scandinavian for a while so I thought I would give it another go.
moves.2. d3: This always seems a little bit too passive to me
moves.2... dxe4 3. d4 Nf6 4. Nc3 e6: Opening a line for one bishop and closing a line for another.
moves.5. Bg5 Be7: This isn't what I would normally do, I tend to prefer Bc4 but I decided to give this a go
moves.6. Bc4 Nbd7 7. Nge2 c5 8. Bxf6 Bxf6 9. N: Defending the c pawn, Qc7 looks better
moves.10. c3 Be7 11. O-O O-O 12. a3 cxd4 13. N: Poor move from white as his lsb is undefended
moves.14... Ne5: This doesn't seem any better, surely the obvious Qxc4 is an improvement
moves.15. f4 Nxc4: Well if he doesn't want his bishop I will (eventually) take it
moves.16. Qe2 a5 17. Nb5: This move is rendered pointless by my next one
Lining the rook up against the white queen
moves.23... Bxd4 24. Nxe6: However I had missed this little trap.
moves.24... Qxc1: I decided I was so far ahead in material I could afford some exchanges
moves.25. Rxc1 Bxe6 26. Rd1 Bb3: The dsb is immune due the threat of a back rank mate, however this is a clear blunder
moves.27. Qxb3 Nf5 28. g4: Aiming the knight at h4 as then I still have the threat of a back rank mate if the white rook strays away
moves.28... Nh4 29. Qg3 Bf6 30. g5 Nf5 31. Qh3: Again threatening Rc1# but I had another plan up my sleeve as we will see
moves.33. Rxe3 Rc1+ 34. Kg2 Rc2+ 35. Kf3: This is a mistake from white, one that I was hoping for but not expecting.
moves.35... Rxe3+ 36. Kxe3 Rc3+ 37. Kd2 Rxh3 3: And white resigned. Thanks for reading, please comment
